title: Headaches and Backlogs Loom as Tax Filing Season Nears Again
sub_head: Mid-April deadline returns as IRS tries to whittle down piles of paperwork
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”The third tax-filing season during the coronavirus pandemic is set to begin soon with more delays, uncertainty and frustration likely for taxpayers and tax preparers.
There will be some signs of business as usual. The individual tax deadline will return to its usual mid-April date for the first time since 2019, and the Internal Revenue Service says it has been steadily reducing its backlog of 2020 returns and other lingering paperwork.
